CatDescriptText: James Fisher, cab driver, Mt. Oliver and Morris Romick, U.S. Army, East Liberty, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, August 27, 1960, pg. A1 with question "What are the most appealing and the least appealing aspects of Republican presidential candidate Richard M. Nixon?"  Mr. Fisher's answer reads: "Considering Nixon and also Kennedy, the fact that both are young is a liability.  The most appealing aspect of Nixon is the fact that he has the President behind him." Mr. Romick's answer reads: "His most appealing aspects are his intelligence and the ability to speak.  His least aspect is in the field of foreign affairs where he is too outspoken and blunt."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of James Fisher wearing light colored short sleeved shirt, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Morris Romick wearing patterned short sleeved shirt, holding bag from Joseph Horne Company, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
